pkgmetadata.longdescription: Correcting Misclassified Binary Outcomes in Association Studies // Use frequentist and Bayesian methods to estimate parameters from a binary outcome misclassification model. These methods correct for the problem of "label switching" by assuming that the sum of outcome sensitivity and specificity is at least 1. A description of the analysis methods is available in Hochstedler and Wells (2023) doi:10.48550/arXiv.2303.10215.
